discourse_list.title: Strategic Finance Core Unit Report - January 2022

content.content: January 2022 reporting for Strategic Finance Core Unit TL;DR  Progress on QSR is being made with contributions from Growth, Risk, Data Insights, PE, and RWF (details below), we look forward to hosting the inaugural meeting following ETH Denver ALM Framework introduced by @Sebventures in partnership with @monet-supply and @Primoz  Collaborating with SES and Delegates on new Core Unit Performance Metrics Building an accounting & finance close framework with key contributions from @mario  Working with the Data Insights team to leverage their database and data sets using our own Snowflake data warehouse Posted our two full-time positions on the Bankless job board, Lead Data Analyst and Lead Financial Analyst and are currently interviewing some excellent candidates  @Kayleigh (FP&A Analyst) and @Shravanrajas (Data Analyst) joining the team part-time  In addition to our recurring financial reporting, the SF CU is working on several key initiatives which will help solidify and bring more clarity to the financial reporting and health of the protocol:  Creating a financial close & accounting process and standardizing our expense reporting. We are developing best practices and a process flow that we hope to share with the community soon which will include a template CU facilitators can leverage to populate expenses. Longer term, we will automate the expense reporting with a script developed by the SES Core Unit which will greatly streamline the process Collaborating with SES and the Delegates to design performance evaluation processes and metrics for Core Units. As @Rune mentioned previously, MKR holders lack transparency into Core Unit activities and there is minimal if any accountability short of threatening to offboard a Core Unit. The community needs a neutral way to assess the performance of each core unit and to hold them accountable for their performance. The expectations of the community, delegates, and MKR holders must be clear to CU facilitators and there must be a forum for alignment on a CU’s mandate and key objectives. Putting a formal process in place will prevent a lot of headaches in the future and improve communication. Shoutout to @Longforwisdom for being the guinea pig and helping out with template design   ALM research led by @SebVentures, which will be instrumental for us in:  Allocating stablecoins held on the protocol’s balance sheet, reducing USDC centralization and generating yield through investment-grade short-term credit investments  Understanding our solvency risk to ensure the backing of DAI and our liquidity risk to maintain the peg of DAI Deciding as a community what our risk appetite is as it relates to the above   Quarterly Strategic Reviews (QSRs)  Q4 QSR deck is nearly complete thanks to contributions from @Tadeo and @piotr.klis on the data side, the Risk, Growth, PE, and RWF teams. We are looking forward to discussing the analysis with the community and encourage everyone to attend the inaugural meeting as we look to build consensus and refine the meeting over time. We’re planning on scheduling the first meeting at the end of the month once the teams return from ETH Denver   Building out the financial and data infrastructure by collaborating with the DIN team - testing out building PowerBI dashboards leveraging the DIN Snowflake database  Public Work Why Accounting Matters ALM Framework History of Dai at Par ValueJanuary Financial Report January Financial Report December Expense Report Team Composition @Aes - Full-time - Facilitator @SebVentures - Full-time - ALM, Financial Infrastructure @Kayleigh - Part-time - Financial Planning & Analysis @Shravanrajas - Part-time - Data Analysis

content.content: February 2022 reporting for Strategic Finance Core Unit TL;DR  QSR presentation was finalized and inaugural meeting was held on March 11th thanks to key contributions from Growth, Risk, Data Insights, PE, and RWF. We look forward to continuing to build and iterate on this process Continued efforts on standardizing accounting and financial close processes and best practices to be shared with the community Beta-tested our new Operating Expense template with GovAlpha, thanks to @Kayleigh and @prose11 for the work and feedback Hired our first two full-time positions, with @adcv and @lyt joining the team Posted a Declaration of Intent to invest the MakerDAO balance sheet in short-term investment grade credit and are working with multiple teams to push this initiative forward Posted an ALM Framework for MakerDAO  Researched a decentralized clearinghouse for stablecoins  Collaborating with SES and Delegates on new Core Unit Performance Metrics Registered as a Gold Sponsor at the Harvard Blockchain Conference & Career Fair to represent MakerDAO with a number of other Core Unit Facilitators, members, and Delegates  Public Work ALM Framework Decentralized Clearinghouse for Stablecoins February Financial Report January Expense Report February Expense Report Team Composition @Aes - Full-time - Facilitator @SebVentures - Full-time - ALM, Financial Infrastructure @adcv - Part-time (soon to be Full-time) - Financial Analysis @lyt - Full-time - Business Analysis @Kayleigh - Part-time - Financial Planning & Analysis @Shravanrajas - Part-time - Data Analysis
